intro: Epilobium nummulariifolium var. angustum, commonly known as narrow-leaf willowherb, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pink to reddish-purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils along streambanks and roadside ditches. It is part of the Onagraceae family, which includes other flowering plants with showy blooms. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological studies and wetland restoration projects.
